title: Lifesense
text:
Lifesense is a six-part <a href="nature%20documentary">nature documentary</a> <a href="television%20series">television series</a> produced by the <a href="BBC%20Natural%20History%20Unit">BBC Natural History Unit</a>, originally broadcast in the United Kingdom on <a href="BBC%20One">BBC1</a> in 1991. The series producer was <a href="John%20Downer%20%28filmmaker%29">John Downer</a> and the narrator <a href="Andrew%20Sachs">Andrew Sachs</a>. It used groundbreaking effects and filming techniques to show how <a href="animal%20perception">animals perceive</a> the wildlife, pioneering techniques reveal our lives from the animal's point of view and creatures across the landscapes from the world around them. The same production team went on to make the series' predecessor "<a href="Supersense">Supersense</a>" in 1988 and to the follow-up series "" in 1999.
Media.
A VHS release of "Lifesense" featuring all six 30-minute episodes was released on 19 September 1995.
A hardcover book to accompany the series, "Lifesense: Our Lives Through Animal Eyes" by John Downer, was released by <a href="BBC%20Books">BBC Books</a> in November 1991 ().
